commit message:
Add start/end columns to schedule database (preparing to sort events by their
date instead of atime in the chooser).
Yes. Don't keep gen/ in bzr.
Update sch_start/end fields in the database from schedule data.

Monster commit: Biggest change is to ChooserActivity - show start/end dates
and use them to group schedules (now, coming up, past). And cleaned up the
repo a bit so 'bzr st' output looks cleaner.
Some more cleaning up of the new chooser layout.
Added translation for menu headers. Menu should work properly again.
Boring stuff: Messing with the margins. Try to convert dp's to pixels.
Oops. Fixed context menu.

Hopefully last cleanup of chooser for now: Remove obsolete scheds array and its
last (incorrect) uses.
Try to download schedules with gzip compression.

The options menu is hardly useful and can only cause confusion in
SearchActivity so disable it there.
Small adjustments. Forgot one translation.

Okay, another parser (although not really new): iCal. Turns out it maps pretty
well to xCal so I can do it internally.

Preseed YAPC. For as long as I mis up both URL and id (usually but not always
sha1sum of URL), added an id column to seeds.
Release time. Hope I didn't add any bad bugs just when CCC started!
Order the seed by date, not by time of me adding entries.
Scraper for Loveland. Should refactor that stuff a bit before I use it again..

Preseed Loveland, and set start/end timestamps to something more sane for
one-day events.

0.9.7. I'm abusing releases to push out small changes to the menu seed. Should
find a better mechanism to update it..

Add the seeded menu as a JSON file instead.

Code is in progress, the first resulting rant can already be found on
https://plus.google.com/u/1/117161704068825702652 . So far I have failed
to find something better... :-/
Use the included .json as the menu seed now. This needs much more work.

Improved the JSON code a little bit.

Now, decouple db version and seed version.
Separated data versioning from database structure version.
Move HTTP caching logic into a separate Fetcher class.

Added TeeReader.readLine() implementation - offline support for iCal files
was broken so far.
Code for fetching menu.json online. Still a bit buggy.

Use a four-state instead of a boolean to indicate a fetch source, so you can
more precisely request how/if cached info is used.

A fifth state to the Fetcher. Something tells me that thing is partially
overengineered.
Actually implemented CACHE_ONLINE behaviour.

All activities can handle screen rotations fine without being recreated. This
fixes a bug where the event dialog disappears on rates when looking at search
results, and stops reloads of the menu (also on rotates).
Adding OpenRheinRuhr 2011.
Enable menu in ChooserActivity too (just for settings).
Fix up Fetcher. (Getting source once the download is going.)

Half-finished (for now hidden) feature: try to, by default, only reload a
schedule online once a day. The current behaviour can be pretty annoying on
slow WiFi/3G.

Won't finish it for now because I have to move the schedule loading to
ChooserActivity - stuff is getting hideously messy the way it is now.
Pfft. 'always_refresh' setting hopefully makes some sense now.
Show a progress indicator when loading a schedule file.

For multi-day schedules in per-day mode, have getTents() omit tents that
have no items for that day.
German translations, thanks to Birgit Huesken for OpenRheinRuhr!

Bump the seed version number. Also, start using DNS SOA serial-like numbers
instead of just a dumb small integer.
